Unsweetened coffee's brain-boosting benefits: How it sharpens memory, cuts Alzheimer's risk - The Times of India
summary:
Unsweetened Coffee's Brain-Boosting Benefits: How it Sharpens Memory, Cuts Alzheimer's Risk

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: American Journal of Clinical Nutrition

This article discusses the significant benefits of consuming unsweetened coffee, particularly its positive effects on brain health and reduced risk of neurodegenerative diseases like Alzheimer's, dementia, and Parkinson’s disease, according to a recent study.

  • Older adults with higher intake of unsweetened coffee show a 29-30% lower risk of Alzheimer’s.
  • Participants who did not sweeten their coffee had a 43% lower risk of mortality from these diseases.
  • Consumption of two to three cups of coffee daily is associated with a 45% lower risk of suicide.
  • Unsweetened coffee is rich in antioxidants and essential nutrients that contribute to lower risks of brain disorders.
“Caffeine may stimulate neurotransmitters that help improve memory and stabilize the blood-brain barrier.”

The findings highlight the advantages of opting for unsweetened coffee not only for its flavor but also for its health benefits, illustrating how dietary choices can significantly impact long-term cognitive health.
newTitle: Unsweetened Coffee's Brain-Boosting Benefits: Memory and Alzheimer's Risk Reduction

title: Jio Financial Services Q3 Results FY 2025: Check quarterly earnings of Mukesh Ambani-led NBFC - Financial performance details - ET Now
summary:
Jio Financial Services Q3 Results FY 2025

Updated: January 17, 2025 19:17 IST

Jio Financial Services Ltd has reported its earnings for the quarter ended December 31, 2024, indicating a flat growth across key metrics.

  • Consolidated profit after tax (PAT) is Rs 295 crore, a growth of 0.3% YoY.
  • Revenue reported at Rs 438 crore, marking a 6.1% increase YoY.
  • AUM (Assets Under Management) stands at Rs 4,199 crore, a significant rise from Q2 FY25.
  • Net profit decline of 57% QoQ from Rs 689 crore in Q2 FY25.
  • Shares ended at Rs 279.05, up 0.83% from the previous close.

Key Highlights

  • Payments bank CASA customers at 1.89 million (+25% QoQ).
  • Payment solutions embedded in JioBharat for merchant onboarding at scale.
  • Insurance broking now across categories and three channels.
  • 7.4 million average MAU across all digital properties of JFSL.

(Disclaimer: The above article is meant for informational purposes only, and should not be considered as any investment advice.)
newTitle: Jio Financial Services Q3 Results FY 2025: Overview of Quarterly Earnings

title: 'Saif Ali Khan wasn't scared': Autorickshaw driver who transported actor to hospital - Hindustan Times
summary:
Autorickshaw Driver Describes Transporting Saif Ali Khan to Hospital After Stabbing

Published on: Jan 17, 2025, Source: Hindustan Times

An auto-rickshaw driver narrated the dramatic events of transporting a bleeding Saif Ali Khan to Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital after the actor was stabbed while protecting his family. The incident raised questions about security and personal safety for public figures.

  • The driver, Bhajan Singh Rana, found Khan bleeding profusely from the neck.
  • Rana did not recognize the actor initially and took approximately 8-10 minutes to reach the hospital.
  • Upon arrival, Khan asked the guard for a stretcher, stating, "I am Saif Ali Khan."
  • Rana revealed that a young boy was also accompanying Khan in the auto-rickshaw.
  • Khan did not appear scared and managed to walk into the hospital without assistance.
“He (Saif) walked into the auto... he did not seem scared and appeared normal,” said Rana.

This incident highlights the unforeseen dangers faced by celebrities and raises concerns about their safety in public and private spaces.
newTitle: Autorickshaw Driver Describes Transporting Saif Ali Khan to Hospital After Stabbing

12 Indians Fighting For Russian Army In Ukraine Killed, 16 Missing: Centre - NDTV
summary:
12 Indians Fighting For Russian Army In Ukraine Killed, 16 Missing: Centre

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Ministry of External Affairs

New Delhi: Twelve Indian nationals, among a total of 126, who were misled into settling in Russia have died fighting for the Russian Army in Ukraine, and sixteen others are currently missing.

  • Ministry of External Affairs confirmed the deaths and the missing status of Indian nationals involved.
  • As of now, 96 out of 126 Indian nationals have returned to India after being discharged from the Russian forces.
  • 18 remain in combat, with 16 being classified as missing by Russian authorities.
  • Prime Minister Narendra Modi has previously raised concerns about the safety of Indian nationals in discussions with Putin.
“So far, 12 Indian nationals have died in combat,” - Randhir Jaiswal, Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson.

This situation highlights the ongoing concerns regarding Indian nationals involved in foreign conflicts and the government's efforts to ensure their safety.
newTitle: 12 Indians Fighting For Russian Army In Ukraine Killed, 16 Missing: Centre

title: Team India for ICC Champions Trophy to be picked in Mumbai on Saturday - The Times of India
summary:
Team India for ICC Champions Trophy to be picked in Mumbai on Saturday

Date: This Saturday, Source: Times of India

MUMBAI: The Indian team for the 2025 ICC Champions Trophy in Dubai and Pakistan, starting February 19, will be announced in Mumbai. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar will hold a press conference after revealing the 15-man squad for the tournament.

  • Jasprit Bumrah is unlikely to be part of the squad due to a back injury.
  • India's campaign begins against Bangladesh on Feb 20.
  • Rohit Sharma is expected to continue as captain despite recent poor form.
  • Karun Nair's impressive performances in domestic cricket raises questions about his selection.
“Whom do you drop if you have to pick Kaun in the 15? You can't drop someone like Shreyas Iyer, who smashed a century in the 2023 ODI World Cup semifinal.”

This weekend's squad announcement will be closely watched as it sets the stage for India's participation in the upcoming tournament.
newTitle: Team India for ICC Champions Trophy to be picked in Mumbai on Saturday

title: 12 Indians working for Russian Army in Ukraine dead, 16 missing, confirms MEA - The Hindu
summary:
12 Indians working for Russian Army in Ukraine dead, 16 missing, confirms MEA

Published: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has confirmed that 12 Indians working with the Russian military have died, while 16 others are reported missing. Russia has communicated these details to India.

  • 12 Indians have been confirmed dead while working for the Russian military.
  • 16 Indians are reported missing, with efforts being made for their release and repatriation.
  • A total of 126 cases of Indian nationals serving in the Russian Army have been noted.
  • 96 Indians have returned to India and are no longer part of the Russian armed forces.
  • The Indian Embassy is involved in the repatriation of remains and treatment of the injured.
“The Russian side has categorised them as missing... We are seeking an early release and repatriation of those who remain.” - Randhir Jaiswal, MEA spokesperson

This situation highlights the ongoing risks faced by Indian nationals involved with foreign militaries amidst the conflict in Ukraine.
newTitle: 12 Indians working for Russian Army in Ukraine dead, 16 missing, confirms MEA

title: 16 Indians Fighting In Russian Army 'Missing', 12 Killed So Far In Ukraine War: MEA - News18
summary:
16 Indians Missing, 12 Reported Dead in Ukraine Conflict: MEA Updates

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: News18

At least 16 Indian nationals deployed by the Russian Army in Ukraine are currently missing, with 12 confirmed dead, as reported by the Ministry of External Affairs.

  • There are 126 Indian nationals known to have served in the Russian Army.
  • 96 of these have returned to India, with 18 still in service.
  • 16 are categorized as missing by Russian authorities, while 12 have died in the conflict.
“As of today, there have been 126 cases (of Indian nationals serving in the Russian Army). Of these 126 cases, 96 people have returned to India and have been discharged from the Russian Armed Forces.” - MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal

The Indian embassy is working with Russian authorities to facilitate the repatriation of the deceased's remains and to assist those who are still serving.
newTitle: 16 Indians Missing, 12 Reported Dead in Ukraine Conflict: MEA Updates

title: NASA Hubble's most detailed image reveals Andromeda galaxy's hidden history - Moneycontrol
summary:
NASA Hubble's Most Detailed Image Reveals Andromeda Galaxy's Hidden History

Date: January 17, 2025 / 17:41 IST

Source: Moneycontrol

The Andromeda galaxy, the closest large galaxy to Earth, has intrigued astronomers for over a century. A new study by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope reveals stunning details about this cosmic neighbour, shedding light on its complex evolution and differences from the Milky Way.

  • Hubble's imaging uncovered over 200 million stars in Andromeda, marking the most detailed survey of the galaxy.
  • The galaxy is located 2.5 million light-years away from Earth.
  • Hubble’s data spans the entire disk of Andromeda, offering a clear view of its stellar population.
  • The telescope can study stars brighter than our Sun.

This is the largest photomosaic ever made by the Hubble Space Telescope, showing Andromeda almost edge-on, tilted by 77 degrees relative to Earth’s view. (Image: NASA)

This is the largest photomosaic ever made by the Hubble Space Telescope.

In conclusion, the new findings from Hubble provide valuable insights into the structure and evolution of the Andromeda galaxy, enhancing our understanding of its differences from the Milky Way and its complex history.
newTitle: NASA Hubble's Most Detailed Image Reveals Andromeda Galaxy's Hidden History

title: Budget session of Parliament from January 31; Budget on February 1 - The Hindu
summary:
Budget session of Parliament from January 31; Budget on February 1

Published on: January 17, 2025 05:39 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

The Budget session of Parliament will convene on January 31, 2025, starting with the President's address and the budget presentation on February 1, 2025.

  • The first part of the session is expected to conclude on February 13, 2025.
  • The second part will be conducted between the second week of March and the first week of April.
  • The Election Commission has advised against any Delhi-centric announcements in the budget due to upcoming Assembly polls on February 5, 2025.
  • Key discussions are expected on the Waqf (amendment) Bill 2024 and simultaneous elections, with reports from respective committees due during the session.
  • The Congress party's position within the INDIA bloc is reportedly weakening.
"For the Opposition, the Delhi election results will be crucial and will set the mood for the session."

The upcoming Budget session is set against the backdrop of significant political activities, including assembly elections and internal party dynamics.
newTitle: Budget session of Parliament from January 31; Budget on February 1

title: BJP releases manifesto for Delhi polls, promises Rs 21,000 for pregnant women, LPG cylinders for Rs 500 - The Indian Express
summary:
BJP releases manifesto: Rs 2,500 for women, more pension for senior citizens, meals for Rs 5

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Indian Express

Aimed at laying the foundation of development in Delhi, BJP's J P Nadda announced a manifesto featuring key welfare schemes including monthly payouts for women and increased pensions for senior citizens.

  • Monthly payout of Rs 2,500 for eligible women under the Mahila Samridhi Yojana.
  • Increased pension for senior citizens from Rs 2,000 to Rs 2,500; and for those above 70 from Rs 2,500 to Rs 3,000.
  • Nutritious meals for Rs 5 at ‘Atal canteens’ across slum clusters.
  • Commitment to eradicate corruption and improve existing welfare schemes.
  • Feedback collected from 1.8 lakh people prior to manifesto announcement.
“Modi’s guarantee means there is a guarantee that the guarantee will be fulfilled.” - J P Nadda

The BJP's manifesto highlights the party's focus on women's welfare, senior citizens' support, and poverty alleviation. The announcement has drawn criticism from AAP’s Arvind Kejriwal, who claims the BJP is mimicking his policies.
newTitle: BJP Unveils Welfare-Focused Manifesto with Promises for Women and Senior Citizens

The Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 showcases the latest in electric vehicles with significant launches from major car manufacturers. Key highlights include the unveiling of the Hyundai Creta EV priced at Rs 17.99 lakh and the Maruti Suzuki eVitara.

title: India approves over ₹10,000 crore funds to revive state-owned steel maker RINL - Mint
summary:
India Approves Over ₹11,000 Crore for RINL Revitalization

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Prime Minister Narendra Modi has sanctioned a financial package of ₹11,440 crore for the revitalization of Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Limited (RINL), as confirmed by Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw.

Key Points:

  • The package includes ₹10,300 crore in fresh equity infusion and a working capital loan of ₹1,140 crore converted to preferred shares.
  • RINL is crucial to India’s steel sector, located strategically in Vizag, Andhra Pradesh.
  • The government aims to address RINL’s legacy challenges and modernize its operations.
  • Efforts will be made to secure raw materials and ensure employee welfare through the revitalization.
“The Visakhapatnam Steel Plant has a special place in the hearts and minds of the people of Andhra Pradesh. This has been done understanding the importance of the steel sector in building an Aatmanirbhar Bharat.” — Narendra Modi

The revival is anticipated to significantly boost the local economy and job market in Andhra Pradesh.
newTitle: India Approves Over ₹11,000 Crore for RINL Revitalization

Supermassive Black hole 700 million times mass of Sun spotted firing energy beam at earth - The Times of India
summary:
Astronomers Discover Ancient Blazar Emitting Energy Beam Towards Earth

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Astrophysical Journal Letters

Astronomers have discovered the most ancient blazar ever observed, a supermassive black hole from the early universe that is shooting an energy beam directly at Earth.

  • The blazar has a mass equal to 700 million suns.
  • It is located approximately 12.9 billion light-years away from Earth.
  • The high-energy beam of radiation took almost 13 billion years to reach us.
  • This blazar is believed to have existed just 800 million years after the Big Bang, making it the most distant blazar recorded.
  • The discovery provides insights into the formation and evolution of supermassive black holes in the early universe.
“The alignment of J0410−0139's jet with our line of sight allows astronomers to peer directly into the heart of this cosmic powerhouse.” - Emmanuel Momjian, National Radio Astronomy Observatory

This remarkable discovery could indicate the presence of many more supermassive black holes from the same era, offering a significant opportunity for further exploration in astronomy.
newTitle: Astronomers Discover Ancient Blazar Emitting Energy Beam Towards Earth

title: China lauds ISRO on successful docking of satellites in space - The Tribune India
summary:
China lauds ISRO on successful docking of satellites in space

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: The Tribune

China has congratulated India's ISRO for successfully docking satellites in space, marking India as the fourth nation to achieve this milestone.

  • The two satellites were docked successfully under the SpaDeX mission.
  • China's spokesperson Yu Jing praised the achievement on social media.
  • India joins the US, Russia, and China as the only countries to have successfully docked satellites.
  • Previous acknowledgments from China include India's Mars Orbiter Mission in 2014 and moon landing accomplishments.
  • There is potential for cooperation between India and China in space exploration and technology.
“Congratulations to India #ISRO for successful docking of satellites under the SpaDeX mission!” - Yu Jing

This successful docking underscores the advancements both nations are making in space technology and the potential for future collaborative efforts.
newTitle: China Congratulates ISRO on Successful Satellite Docking

Wipro Q3 Results: Net profit rises 24.5% YoY to ₹3,354 crore; dividend declared - Mint
summary:
Wipro Q3 Results: Net Profit Up 24.5% Year-on-Year to ₹3,354 Crore

Publication Date: January 28, 2025

Source: Live Mint

Wipro Ltd, a major player in IT services, reported a 24.5% year-on-year increase in its consolidated net profit for Q3FY25, reaching ₹3,354 crore, marking a 4.5% sequential rise as well. The company also declared an interim dividend of ₹6 per share.

  • Consolidated net profit for Q3FY25: ₹3,354 crore.
  • Year-ago profit in Q3FY24 was ₹2,694.2 crore.
  • Consolidated revenue for Q3FY25 rose to ₹22,319 crore.
  • Shares ended down 2.17% on BSE at ₹281.80.
  • Interim dividend of ₹6 per share declared.
“Interim dividend of ₹6 per share to be distributed to the shareholders.”

This performance reflects Wipro's resilience amidst market fluctuations, as it continues to adapt to evolving industry demands.
newTitle: Wipro Q3 Results: Net Profit Up 24.5% Year-on-Year to ₹3,354 Crore
